required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study in Korea of Entecavir Versus Lamivudine in Adults With Chronic Hepatitis B Infection
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase IV Study of the Antiviral Activity and Safety of Entecavir Versus Lamivudine in Adults With Chronic Hepatitis B Infection Who Are Negative for Hepatitis B e Antigen in Korea

brief_summary.textblock: Entecavir, 0.5 mg daily, will have clinical efficacy (assessed as an undetectable hepatitis B DNA, <300 copies/mL, by Roche Comprehensive Bio-Analytical System Amplicor polymerase chain reaction assay) that is comparable (noninferior) and potentially superior to lamivudine, 100 mg once daily, in adults with hepatitis B e antigen-negative chronic hepatitis B virus infection.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved a Virologic Response at Week 24
primary_outcome.description: Virologic response=Hepatitis B virus DNA <300 copies/mL by polymerase chain reaction assay.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) DNA <10^3, <10^4, or < 10^5 Copies/mL by Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) Assy at Weeks 24, 48, and 96
secondary_outcome.description: The number and percentage of participants achieving the following endpoints will be tabulated at each visit through Week 240 by treatment group: HBV DNA <300 copies/mL by PCR assay; HBV DNA <10^3, <10^4, or < 10^5 copies/mL by PCR assay. Treatment comparisons will be assessed using the same method as the primary endpoint.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Log10 Reduction From Baseline in Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) DNA at Weeks 24, 48, 96, 144, 192, and 240
secondary_outcome.description: Mean log10 reduction from Baseline in HBV DNA virus by the Roche Comprehensive Bio-Analytical System Amplicor polymerase chain reaction (PCR) assay at Week 24. The extent of the decrease was estimated by comparing HBV DNA levels of all participants in each group with a linear regression model with covariates of treatment and baseline HBV DNA by PCR assay.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Laboratory Test Values for Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT) at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Mean ALT values from baseline by laboratory test. .

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Normalization of Serum Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT) Levels at Weeks 24, 48, and 96
secondary_outcome.description: Normalization of serum ALT= ≤*institutional upper limit of normal.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Death as Outcome, Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Discontinuations Due to Adverse Events (AEs), Most Common AEs, and Grade 3/4 AEs at Week 24
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Start of dosing (Day 1) until end of treatment (Week 24) + 5 days and to end of 24-week follow-up period
secondary_outcome.description: AE=any new unfavorable symptom, sign, or disease or worsening of a preexisting condition that may not have a causal relationship with treatment. SAE=a medical event that at any dose results in death, persistent or significant disability/incapacity, or drug dependency/abuse; is life-threatening, an important medical event, or a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or requires or prolongs hospitalization. Most common AEs=AEs affecting ≥3 participants. Grade 3 (Severe)/Grade 4 (Very Severe)AEs per World Health Organization (WHO) criteria.Serious adverse events/deaths reported for enrolled patients regardless of treatment status.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Elevations in Alanine Transaminase (ALT) and Aspartate Aminoaminase (AST) Levels, Elevations in ALT and AST Levels,Simultaneous Elevations in ALT and Total Bilirubin Levels, and ALT Flares at Week 24
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Start of dosing (Day 1) until end of treatment (24 weeks) + 5 days and to end of 24-week follow-up period
secondary_outcome.description: ALT flares=ALT>2*Baseline and 10*upper limit of normal. Serious adverse events/deaths reported for enrolled patients regardless of treatment status.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Grade 3 or 4 Abnormalities in Laboratory Test Results by World Health Organization (WHO) Criteria at Week 24
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Start of dosing (Day 1) until end of treatment (Week 24) + 5 days and to the end of the 24-week follow-up period
secondary_outcome.description: ULN=upper limit of normal; ALT=alanine transaminase. WHO criteria: Grade 3=Severe (inability to carry out usual activity); Grade 4=Very severe (debilitating or significantly incapacitating patient despite symptomatic treatment).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Clinically or Statistically Significant Changes in Vital Sign Measurements at Week 24
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Start of dosing (Day 1) until end of treatment (Week 24) + 5 days and to end of 24-week follow-up period
secondary_outcome.description: Vital signs assessed included blood pressure, heart rate, body temperature, and respiration rate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Virologic Rebound at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Virologic rebound was defined as a confirmed ≥1 log10 increase in hepatitis B virus (HBV) DNA from nadir on blinded treatment (as determined by 2 sequential HBV DNA measurements or last on-treatment measurement).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Virologic Response as Defined by Undetectable Hepatitis B Virus DNA at Weeks 48, 96, 144, 192, and 240
secondary_outcome.description: Undetectable HBV DNA= <300 copies/mL by polymerase chain reaction assay

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Viral Rebound and Drug-resistant Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) DNA Mutations at Week 96
secondary_outcome.description: Virologic rebound was defined as a confirmed ≥1 log10 increase in HBV DNA from nadir on blinded treatment (as determined by 2 sequential HBV DNA values or last on-treatment measurement).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Death as Outcome, Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Discontinuations Due to Adverse Events (AEs), Most Common AEs, and Grade 3/4 AEs at Week 240
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Start of dosing (Day 1) until end of treatment (Week 240) + 5 days
secondary_outcome.description: AE=any new unfavorable symptom, sign, or disease or worsening of a preexisting condition that may not have a causal relationship with treatment. SAE=a medical event that at any dose results in death, persistent or significant disability/incapacity, or drug dependency/abuse; is life-threatening, an important medical event, or a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or requires or prolongs hospitalization.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Grade 3 or 4 Abnormalities in Laboratory Test Results by World Health Organization (WHO) Criteria at Week 96
secondary_outcome.description: ULN=upper limit of normal; ALT=alanine transaminase. WHO criteria: Grade 3=Severe (inability to carry out usual activity); Grade 4=Very severe (debilitating or significantly incapacitating patient despite symptomatic treatment).

arm_group.description: Entecavir + Lamivudine placebo (0-96 weeks) Entecavir (96-240 weeks)
Lamivudine + Entecavir placebo (0-96 weeks) Lamivudine (96-240 weeks)

intervention.description: Tablets, Oral, 0.5 mg, once daily (0-96 weeks) and (96-240 weeks)
Capsules, Oral, 0 mg, once daily (0-96 weeks)
Capsules, Oral, 100 mg, once daily (0-96 weeks) Tablets, Oral, 100 mg, once daily (96-240 weeks)
Tablets, Oral, 0 mg, once daily (0-96 weeks)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Nucleoside and nucleotide-naive subjects with chronic HBV infection
- Hepatitis B Surface antigen(HBsAg)-positive ≥6 months
- Detectable HBsAg
- HBV DNA ≥ 105 copies/mL by PCR
- ALT 1.3 to 10 x the ULN
- HBeAg negative, anti-hepatitis B Virus E antigen antibody (anti-HBeAb) positive status

link.description: For FDA Safety Alerts and Recalls refer to the following link www.fda.gov/MEDWATCH/safety.htm

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 122 participants were enrolled in this study; 2 did not receive treatment.

group.title: Entecavir, 0.5 mg + Placebo
group.description: Participants received entecavir, 0.5 mg, once daily, with lamivudine placebo tablets, once daily, administered orally through Week 96 (double-blind period). Then, participants received entecavir, 0.5 mg, once daiy, administered orally for Weeks 96-240 (open-label period).

group.title: Lamivudine, 100 mg + Placebo
group.description: Participants received lamivudine, 100 mg, once daily, with entecavir placebo tablets, once daily, administered orally, through Week 96 (double-blind period). Then, participants received lamivudine, 0.5 mg, once daiy, administered orally for Weeks 96-240 (open-label period).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved a Virologic Response at Week 24
measure.description: Virologic response=Hepatitis B virus DNA <300 copies/mL by polymerase chain reaction assay.
measure.population: Randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug

analysis.groups_desc: A sample size of 60 per group provides 80% power for testing superiority of entecavir compared to lamivudine, assuming a response rate of 62% for lamivudine and 83% for entecavir.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The difference in proportion along with its standard error and 90% confidence interval was computed. If the lower limit of the confidence interval (CI) was great than -10%, noninferiority was established. Provided that noninferiority was established, a test for superiority was planned to check that the lower limit of the 90% CI was greater than zero.
analysis.p_value_desc: There was no adjustment for the prior test of noninferiority because the test for superiority could succeed only if noninferiority was first established.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) DNA <10^3, <10^4, or < 10^5 Copies/mL by Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) Assy at Weeks 24, 48, and 96
outcome.description: The number and percentage of participants achieving the following endpoints will be tabulated at each visit through Week 240 by treatment group: HBV DNA <300 copies/mL by PCR assay; HBV DNA <10^3, <10^4, or < 10^5 copies/mL by PCR assay. Treatment comparisons will be assessed using the same method as the primary endpoint.

measure.title: Mean Log10 Reduction From Baseline in Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) DNA at Weeks 24, 48, 96, 144, 192, and 240
measure.description: Mean log10 reduction from Baseline in HBV DNA virus by the Roche Comprehensive Bio-Analytical System Amplicor polymerase chain reaction (PCR) assay at Week 24. measure.population: Randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug

analysis.groups_desc: Changes from baseline were based on patients with measurements at both Baseline and Week 24.
analysis.p_value_desc: Treatment comparisons were based on 2-sided t-test for treatment difference (entecavir: lamivudine) estimated from the linear regression model with covariates of treatment and baseline hepatitis B DNA by PCR.

analysis.groups_desc: Changes from Baseline were based on patients with measurements at both Baseline and at Week 48.
analysis.p_value_desc: Treatment comparisons were based on 2-sided t-test for treatment difference (entecavir: lamivudine) estimated from the linear regression model with covariants of treatment and Baseline hepatitis B DNA by PCR.

analysis.groups_desc: Changes from Baseline were based on patients with measurements at both Baseline and at 96 Weeks.
analysis.p_value_desc: Treatment comparisons were based on 2-sided t-test for treatment difference (entecavir: lamivudine) estimated from the linear regression model with covariants of treatment and Baseline hepatitis B DNA by PCR.

analysis.groups_desc: Changes from Baseline were based on patients with measurements at both Baseline and at Week 144.
analysis.p_value_desc: Treatment comparisons were based on 2-sided t-test for treatment difference (entecavir: lamivudine) estimated from the linear regression model with covariants of treatment and Baseline hepatitis B DNA by PCR.

analysis.groups_desc: Changes from Baseline were based on patients with measurements at both Baseline and at Week 192.
analysis.p_value_desc: Treatment comparisons were based on 2-sided t-test for treatment difference (entecavir: lamivudine) estimated from the linear regression model with covariants of treatment and Baseline hepatitis B DNA by PCR.

analysis.p_value_desc: Treatment comparisons were based on 2-sided t-test for treatment difference (entecavir: lamivudine) estimated from the linear regression model with covariants of treatment and Baseline hepatitis B DNA by PCR.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Death as Outcome, Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Discontinuations Due to Adverse Events (AEs), Most Common AEs, and Grade 3/4 AEs at Week 240
outcome.description: AE=any new unfavorable symptom, sign, or disease or worsening of a preexisting condition that may not have a causal relationship with treatment. SAE=a medical event that at any dose results in death, persistent or significant disability/incapacity, or drug dependency/abuse; is life-threatening, an important medical event, or a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or requires or prolongs hospitalization.
outcome.time_frame: Start of dosing (Day 1) until end of treatment (Week 240) + 5 days
outcome.population: Participants who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of study drug

group.title: Entecavir, 0.5 mg + Placebo
group.description: Participants received entecavir, 0.5 mg, once daily, with lamivudine placebo tablets, once daily, administered orally through Week 96 (double-blind period). Then, participants received entecavir, 0.5 mg, once daiy, administered orally for Weeks 96-240 (open-label period).

group.title: Lamivudine, 100 mg + Placebo
group.description: Participants received lamivudine, 100 mg, once daily, with entecavir placebo tablets, once daily, administered orally, through Week 96 (double-blind period). Then, participants received lamivudine, 0.5 mg, once daiy, administered orally for Weeks 96-240 (open-label period).

measure.title: Number of Participants With Death as Outcome, Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Discontinuations Due to Adverse Events (AEs), Most Common AEs, and Grade 3/4 AEs at Week 240
measure.description: AE=any new unfavorable symptom, sign, or disease or worsening of a preexisting condition that may not have a causal relationship with treatment. SAE=a medical event that at any dose results in death, persistent or significant disability/incapacity, or drug dependency/abuse; is life-threatening, an important medical event, or a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or requires or prolongs hospitalization.
measure.population: Participants who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of study drug

class.title: Nonserious AEs related to study conditions

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Grade 3 or 4 Abnormalities in Laboratory Test Results by World Health Organization (WHO) Criteria at Week 96
outcome.description: ULN=upper limit of normal; ALT=alanine transaminase. WHO criteria: Grade 3=Severe (inability to carry out usual activity); Grade 4=Very severe (debilitating or significantly incapacitating patient despite symptomatic treatment).
outcome.population: Randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug and who were evaluable.

group.title: Entecavir, 0.5 mg + Placebo
group.description: Participants received entecavir, 0.5 mg, once daily, with lamivudine placebo tablets, once daily, administered orally through Week 96 (double-blind period). Then, participants received entecavir, 0.5 mg, once daiy, administered orally for Weeks 96-240 (open-label period).

group.title: Lamivudine, 100 mg + Placebo
group.description: Participants received lamivudine, 100 mg, once daily, with entecavir placebo tablets, once daily, administered orally, through Week 96 (double-blind period). Then, participants received lamivudine, 0.5 mg, once daiy, administered orally for Weeks 96-240 (open-label period).

measure.title: Number of Participants With Grade 3 or 4 Abnormalities in Laboratory Test Results by World Health Organization (WHO) Criteria at Week 96
measure.description: ULN=upper limit of normal; ALT=alanine transaminase. WHO criteria: Grade 3=Severe (inability to carry out usual activity); Grade 4=Very severe (debilitating or significantly incapacitating patient despite symptomatic treatment).
measure.population: Randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug and who were evaluable.

reported_events.time_frame: Start of dosing (Day 1) until end of treatment (Week 240) + 5 days

group.title: Entecavir , 0.5 mg + Placebo
group.description: Participants received entecavir, 0.5 mg, once daily, with lamivudine placebo tablets, once daily, administered orally through Week 96 (double-blind period). Then, participants received entecavir, 0.5 mg, once daiy, administered orally for Weeks 96-240 (open-label period).

group.title: Lamivudine, 100 mg + Placebo
group.description: Participants received lamivudine, 100 mg, once daily, with entecavir placebo tablets, once daily, administered orally, through Week 96 (double-blind period). Then, participants received lamivudine, 0.5 mg, once daiy, administered orally for Weeks 96-240 (open-label period).

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.
